description:
Nepenthe in a four-armed woman from the battle-torn world of Themax-2. She abandoned the surface world to avoid the slaughter.Â 
Â 
She discovered Bloodseed and fell in love with him. She tried to convince him to stay with her, but Bloodseed asked her to see what his future held. She was horrified by what she saw, but knew he needed to go on his journey, not stay by her side. She wiped his memory of her and returned him to the surface.
name: Nepenthe

deck: The Living Manifestation of Fear
description:
OriginÂ 

ManyÂ centuries Â ago,Â a young Odin met the being named the Dark Man and his wife Desire. Recognizing who the Dark Man was Odin proved victourios over him. A couple of centuries later when Thor had just earned the Mjolnir, he,Â Loki and the Warriors Three went to Nornheim looking for adventure. They were confronted by the Dark Man who challenged Thor and at Loki's instigation he accepted, despite his own willingness to appease the mysterious and dark being.Â Thor was told by the Dark Man to strike first and whenÂ Thor did, the Dark Man`s head flew off. ToÂ everyone's astonishment the Dark Man simply walked to his head and reattach it. He then told Thor it was his turn to strike but Thor would have to first travel to his land.Â Loki went with Thor but upon reaching a solid bridge made of gold, they met the Dark Man's wife Desire,Â Loki fled fearful and spooked.Â Thor resisted her charm and went to confront the Dark Man, but not before traversing a hallway of giant stone statues. When they battled each other the Dark Man was holding the upper hand and asked Thor if he now knew who he was. In which Thor replied " Thou art death incarnate!", and as the Dark Man approachÂ with his axe held high, said, "Your death, perhaps...but no, I am not death!"Â Â Thor then told him that he wouldn't beg for mercy only that he wished his father knew that he die as aÂ true son of Odin. At this point Desire once again tried to interrupt the fight and to claim Thor as her own, only to be rejected by the Thunder god. Thor's stubbornness and refusual to give in to either Desire or the Dark Man. Thor's love weakened the DarkÂ Man, turning the tides to Thor's favor. Dark Man recognizing this explains to Thor of what just happened and in turn gives ThorÂ his horse and told him that Thor's pride and boyish terrors had been overcomed. He transported him back toÂ AsgardÂ where Odin recongnized the horse and sent it back to the Dark Man, wanting nothing from him nor his wife.Â 
Â 

CreationÂ 

Created by Steven Grant, Greg LaRocque and Ricardo Villamonte, the character of the Dark Man first appears in Thor #323.Â 
Â 

Powers and AbilitiesÂ 

The Dark Man possesses extremely high levels of resiliency and was capable of functioning normally whilst decapitated. He is otherwise, extremely strong, with incalculable strength levels, extremely durable, immortal and appears to be fed from fear. Dark Man can generate powerful energy blasts from his hands. Dark Man can teleport through space, and through and to other dimensions. It is possible that he may be of an abstract nature. Even the All Father Odin is weary of the Dark Man. He wields a large ax. The Dark Man and his nature means, that he can not harm those who do not fear him. Â  Â Â 
Â 
Physical CharacteristicsÂ 
Height:Â 7'
Weight:Â 480 lbs
Hair:Â Black
Eyes: Purple
name: Dark Man

deck: Living Embodiment of Desire
description:
OriginÂ 

The seductive and mysterious Desire, although married to the Dark Man, is also a temptress that entraps men with her charms and seductions. Wife of the Dark Man, she had once triedÂ OdinÂ to not battle her husband. Both her and Dark Man failed to make a victim of Odin however.Â  Many centuries later, Thor, and his brother Loki and his comrades Fandral, Volstagg, and Hogun, otherwise known as the Warriors Three, set out for adventure and challenge. Venturing forth to Nornheim they encounter a fearsome presence in the Dark Man. A mysterious, blue skinned behemoth that challenges the group. Loki ever the instigator worsens the situation by retorting aggressively and it is left to Thor to find resolution. The Dark Man offering the first strike finds Thor punching his head off, but the bodiless head smiles as his headless body functions reconnects the two body parts. Mystified by the demonstration of ability by this stranger, Dark Man asserts his right to strike back but informs Thor that he must met him the Dark Man in his domain. Only Thor and Loki follow on and it is Desire they run into next, Desire well aware of her husbands machinations. She seeks to seduce and make both brothers her victims. Loki flees in terror but Thor stays steady and determined in his challenge to the Dark Man.Â On his way there Thor passes several of Desire's victims, in the form of huge stone statues, all heroes and adventurers that fall into her trap, and transformed to stone by her kiss. Â  Â 
Â 

CreationÂ 

Created by Steven Grant, Greg LaRocque and Ricardo Villamonte, the character of Desire first appears inÂ Thor #323.Â Â 
Â 

Powers and Abilities

Desire had the ability to turn men to stone by kissing them luring them with passion and promises of desires sated. The hallways leading to the Dark Mans private domain are filled with the stone corpses of many heroes and adventurers who have fallen to Desire's influence and powers. Desire also has the ability to fly, and is immune to conventional forms of injury. She be be of an abstract origin. Â
name: Desire

deck: Maire O'Connell was a former disciple of the demon sorcerer, Belasco. She sought Magik's aid to break the curse of immortality Belasco placed on her.
description:
History

Maire O'Connell was a former disciple of the demon sorcerer, Belasco. Â She sought the aid of Magik, believing her to be the ruler of Limbo. Â Initially unaware that MagikÂ had abandoned Limbo after Magus had infected the demons with the transmode virus, O'Connell explained that Belasco had cursed her with immortality and asked Rasputin to take her Belascoâs tower to locate a spell in the library that would break the curse. Magik, not wanting to jeopardize the lives of the New Mutants or risk her headmasterâs rejection, agreed to teleport Maire to Limbo. Â There they were promptly attacked by Sym, and his minions.Â Â 
Â 
After fleeing the demons and securing themselves inside of Belascoâs fortress, the girls spent hours locating the spell to break the curse on OâConnell. After locating the spell, Magik began to cast it, when Sym and his demons broke into the tower. Â O'Connell, know that if Magik was disrupted while casting the spell would ruin it. Â Therefore she valiantly fought off the demons by herself. Magik completed the spell, and OâConnellâs mortality was restored.Â 
Â 
Unfortunately, mere moments later, one of Symâs demons hurled a spear into O'Connellâs side. Horrified, Magik teleported O'Connell back to earth, seeking medical attention for her wound. As she lay in the medical room of Xavierâs School, Magneto explained to Magik that OâConnellâs wound was too severe, and that she could not be saved. O'Connell thanked Magik for helping her, and told her not to grieve as her time to die had long since past. OâConnell then succumbed to her injury, leaving a heartbroken Magik to weep over her body. Â Â 
Â 

Powers And Abilities

  • Maire was cursed with immortality while a disciple of the demonic sorcerer, Belasco. She has been trained in magic, however the full extent of her knowledge may never be known. Maire was also an accomplished swordswoman, capable of defending Illyana Rasputin from S'ym's minions while she performed a magic spell.
name: Maire O'Connell

description:
Gaylord Picaro was born in Reading, Pennsylvania. When we first see Pit Bull he's in the Pitt's surrounding area with his band of scavengers, the Wardogs. While there, he found half of the paranormal group DP7. He fought their leader Jennifer Swenson,she threw a grenade at him, buying time for the team to retreat. He decided to followed Meriam Sorenson and encountered her team mate Dave Landers. During their fight Pit Bull bit Dave, angered Dave broke Pit Bull's jaw and slammed him into a wall.

Not long after, the US started drafting all the paranormals into the army. At Fort Benning, he began to relentlessly pick on Harley Mook. This led to Mook's attempt to kill Pit Bull. Jeff Walters managed to save his life and Pit Bull has considered Jeff his best friend ever since.

Durind his time at Fort Benning, the paranormal team Psi-Force attacked, trying to free their teammate Thomas Boyd. Pit Bull tried to stop Boyd, but was overpowered by him.

Later, Psi-Force's Tyrone Jessup was captured and brought to Fort Benning. Not learning his lesson, Pit Bull began picking on Tyrone. Jessup got his revenge by injuring Pit Bull during a training exercise.

Gearing up for World War 3, Pit Bull met the Paranormal Platoon's commanding officer, Major Kathi Blizzard. The platoon was given a pass, and Pit Bull tried to go AWOL. Pit Bull soon encountered Sgt. Haldeman, and was sent back. The next day the platoon went to South Africa.

Soon after arriving Pit Bull noticed something was wrong when he noticed the hatred Colonel Oort possessed toward Jeff Walters, based purely on Jeff's skin color. The platoon were ordered by Colonel Oort to attack the rebels that he claimed were sheltering the paranormal responsible for destroying Pittsburgh. During the battle Pit Bull was left behind when the platoon was ordered to pull out. Pit Bull went berserk, and massacred the rebels before he was reunited with the rest of the platoon.

The platoon then destroyed Colonel Oort's tanks, rescued Blizzard and Walters, and they all fled back to America.

Years later, Nightmask assembled a group of paranormals, including Pit Bull, to stop the alien invasion of Skeletron. Kayla Ballantine, now possessing the Starbrand, appeared before the group warning them that Skeletron was close. Quasar soon arrived and took the group to Skeletron's ship. Skeletron was eventually defeated and trapped in the New Universe, and the Stranger brought the New Universe Earth to the regular Marvel Universe to study it. Their Earth was then sealed off by the Living Tribunal.

issue_credits.name: The End Of The World (As We Know It))

name: Pitbull

first_appeared_in_issue.name: Public Enemy Number One; Behind the Eight Ball; Rumors of War

issue_credits.name: Public Enemy Number One; Behind the Eight Ball; Rumors of War

deck: A assassin hired by a corrupt judge to kill Ben Urich.
description:
History

When Daily Bugle reporter Ben Urich found ties between Judge Elias Tomb and organized crime, the judge hired Purge to eliminate the reporter. Purge soon found himself battling against Phil Urich, as the Green Goblin, and Daredevil. Unable fulfill his contract he decided his reputation would skyrocket if he were able to kill Daredevil, having dismissed the Green Goblin as a mere amateur. This was a mistake as his dismissal allowed the Goblin to blow him off rooftop with a well placed pumpkin bomb. Falling to the street below Purge was saved by the Goblin. In repayment but Purge began to strangle him. The Green Goblin began to slam Purge into the ledge of nearby building, eventually knocking him unconscious. The current whereabouts of Purge are unknown.

Abilities and Equipment

Purge is also a reasonably skilled martial artist and carries an arm-mounted rifle which fires "specially ordered and highly expensive ammo".
name: Purge

aliases:
Death Rattle 
Erasmus Rayne
Father Rayne

description: A master manipulator, he was not able to escape Arkham. The first sacrifice in Doodlebug's masterpiece. Goaded by the spirits of his victims, he lept into a fiery portal to Hell.
name: Death Rattle

volume_credits.name: Batman Arkham Asylum: Living Hell - The Deluxe Edition

deck: Often at odds with Aquaman, even going so far as to challenge him for the throne of Atlantis, Noble has been both an enemy and an ally to the King of the Seven Seas.
description:
Creation

Noble was created by Erik Larsen and Eric Battle. He made his debut in Aquaman #50, where he served as a ally to the Atlanteans and a rival to Aquaman for the affections of Mera.

History

Noble is the king of the Lurkers, an ancient underwater race who lived beneath the seafloor. They were eventually brought up by the noise cause by the citizens of Poseidonis in their celebration attacking and destroying the dome around the city. He then came to battle Aquaman and his troops with Aquaman and Noble squaring off one on one. Aquaman noted that while the Lurkers might be stronger the Atlanteans were faster. Aquaman stunned Noble with electricity but he quickly recovered and then saved an Atlantean child from death, which drew the attention of Queen Mera. However as they attempted to speak Aquaman attacked him with a whale and then managed to defeat him by bringing him to the surface at superspeed and causing gases to build in his body due to the instant change in pressure ,to the point where he was about to pop however Aquaman spared his life.

Aquaman then gave him a translating device and he became second in command of the Atlantean cities, placing him in charge of defending them. The three then return to Noble's city where Noble and Mera grow closer due to her feeling he reminds her of Aquaman before all the tragedies changed him. However she is shortly captured and at Aquaman's insistence Noble accompanies him to save her despite his great fear of the RockCreatures. He then follows and is faced by the Lava Lord. Aquaman defeats the monster and gains the Lurker's safety while afterwards Mera remains to explore the city with Noble while Aquaman returns home.

Noble takes part in the battle to defend Atlantis during the events of Day of Judgment where he is injured by a blast of hellfire by a escaped demon.He is then forced out of the battle, where Mera has Vulko has several tests run where they learn he secretes pheromones with have been reacting strongly with her alien physiology. Following his injury at the demon's hands he leaves his kingdom to be ruled by his cousin, Virtue as he begins a search for the lost cities of the Lurkers so he can fully unite his people.

Noble bears a resemblance to Marvel's King of Atlantis, Namor the Sub-Mariner both in attitude and image (pointy ears and long hair). Their names also start with the letter "N" and he is also kind of an antihero like Namor. Finally he also serves as a potential romantic foil to the hero, similar to Namor with Reed Richards and his wife Sue Richards.

Powers and Abilities

Noble being adapted for the sea can breathe underwater. Also because he lives at a lower depths he is far stronger and more durable then an average Atlantean.

Superhuman Strength

Noble and the Lurkers are stronger than average Atlanteans, due to living at depths with more pressure. He was shown as potentially stronger than Aquaman (who is a super-Atlantean) and seemed to be more unstoppable the more enraged he became. He was responsible for ripping out the second version of Aquaman's hook and causing him to upgrade.

Superhuman Durability

Noble and the Lurkers are more durable than average Atlanteans. Noble was able to fight Aquaman for an extended period of time and was able to survive being electrocuted.

Underwater Adaptation

Like all Lurkers, Noble is able to normally function and move underwater, unfazed by the pressure, temperatures or lack of light. He is very fast, being able to race and save an Atlantean child in danger, and agile but not as fast as Aquaman.

Pheromone Secretion

Noble (and possibly his species in general) secretes some kind of pheromone that can attract members of the opposite sex. This seemed to be an unintentional side effect oh his physiology.

Skilled Warrior

Noble is shown as a skilled warrior both in armed and unarmed combat and he leads his army from the front-line.

Leadership

Noble is the king of the Lurkers and the leader of their army. After his introduction he becomes second in command to Aquaman. As a royal he has access to a lot of wealth and resources.
name: Noble

deck: Pixie is the twin sister of Dixie. She was turned into a vampire by Von Kreist's minions.
description:
Pixie was the daughter of former New York city crime boss, Don Fattoni. Pixie always made her twin sister know that she was the more loved among the two, which in turn made Dixie a little jealous of her father's affection towards Pixie.

Even though they might have been a dysfunctional family, Don Fattoni did however love his daughters that he never intended to bring any harm towards them with his line of work. However, that all changed when his gang were involved in a territorial war with vampires. Von Kreist and his vampire minions were sent by Monsignor Pesaro to kill Don Fattoni as an example to other crime families who opposed them.

Vampirella came to the Donâs mansion to warn him of the imminent threat, but The Don had his men ambush Vampirella thinking she was an assassin send by his enemy. While the Donâs men were interrogating Vampirella in the cellar, Von Kreist and his vampire minions stormed the mansion, killing everyone and destroying everything in their wake.

Von Kreist decided to have some fun with Fattoni and his daughters by having Fattoni choose which of his daughter would live and which one would die, a la Sophie's choice. Fattoni reluctantly chose for Pixie to live, but Von Kreist shot Pixie instead so that the Don would be forced to watch his precious daughter die, while Dixie would forever know that Pixie is more precious to her father than she ever will be.

With Pixie almost dying, Von Kreist decided to "save her" by having his minions feed off her flesh at the request of the Do,n who begged for her life. Von Kreist ended up having Dixie kill Fattoni, which was enough to satisfy Von Kreist's sick game that in the end he spared Dixie's life and had Pixie abducted for purposes unknown.

Pixie would later resurface as a newly turned vampire serving under Monsignor Pesaro and Von Kreist, much to the shock and dismay of Vampirella and Dixie. After Von Kreist had his minions dump a sedated Vampirella into the Hudson River, Pixie took Dixie as her "pet". Pixie would then verbally and physically abuse Dixie, forcing her to commit immoral acts until Von Kreist intervened and requested Pixie to kill her sister as a way to prove her loyalty towards Monsignor Pesaro and the clan.

Pixie finally confesses to Dixie that she always thought Dixie was just like their father, but even though no matter how much Dixie tried to gain their father's respect it was always Pixie who received more love among the two. In the final moments, however, Pixie somewhat has a change of heart and stabs Von Kreist in his right eye. Von Kreist doesn't take her actions to kindly and ends up decapitating her.

issue_credits.name: Home is where the hate is

name: Pixie Fattoni

deck: Rhodan was evolved from a rat into humanoid form, he was an assassin and master of his Hounds of Helios.
description:
Rhodan was created by Man-Beast when he evolved him from a rat into humanoid form. Rhodan was a relentless assassin and master of his Hounds of Helios. Man-Beast sent Rhodan and his hounds on a mission to eliminate HIM aka Adam Warlock when he landed in Southern California. Warlock was attacked by one hound but he killed it by breaking its neck. Warlock took flight and met Rhodan in the air on his flying chariot. Warlock killed the other hound with his gemstone and Rhodan retreated into a barn. Warlock followed Rhodan and used his gemstone to revert his enemy back into a rat. A loud screech could be heard and Rhodan in rat form was killed by a cat inside the barn.

Creation

Rhodan was created by Roy Thomas and Gil Kane in 1972 and first appeared in Marvel Premiere # 2.

Powers & Abilities

Rhodan was a rat-humanoid with enhanced strength, claws and heightened senses due to his animal attributes. Rhodan attained flight on his chariot which was drawn by two hounds of Helios. The hounds were two massive wolves that had wings, razor sharp claws and fangs.
name: Rhodan

He was planning to get another term by winning the elections by extrosian and other means. Warkovsky's plans however failed witch resulted in his defeat in the elections.

description:
Slaymaker was a sorcerer based in San Francisco. He was once a young artist who had several wild thoughts and ideas. His problem being materializing them in actual work. He turned to the study of magic in hopes of discovering such a way. He mastered the art of transfiguration, learning how to shape living tissue to whatever form he could think of. Able to even create a small army of demonic-looking servants. Uncertain where he got the living material for that.

When located by the Defenders, Slaymaker was working on his greatest masterpiece: the Panetropic Engine. The Engine consisted of a pyramid of living bodies which would effectively increase his magical powers to reality-shaping levels. He managed to defeat Dr. Druid and Spider-Woman/Julia Cornwall Carpenter and add them to his pyramid. While Slaymaer was distracted with facing Cadaver and USAgent, the two captive heroes took over the Engine from within. An attempt to wrestle back control from them only resulted in the engine exploding. Slaymaker was left in a coma but was happily able to explore his own subconscious while at it.

Creation

Slaymaker was created by Tom Brevoort and Bill Wylie in 1994 and first appeared in The Secret Defenders # 20.

first_appeared_in_issue.name: Death and the Art of Living

issue_credits.name: Death and the Art of Living

name: Slaymaker

deck: A speedster who Deadpool was hire to kill.
description:
Street Speeder is an individual who is "A guy who runs really fast -- sometimes after 9:00 PM", according to a pair of old ladies who where very bothered by the running, and wished to hire someone to kill him. They tried the Avengers, but they don't kill people - at least not for money. Then the ladies heard of Deadpool, who was "a conscience-free lowlife scum who felt no remorse about snuffing out a human life." Deadpool thought these ladies wouldn't have the cash to hire him, but they had a big bake sale and raised exactly $21,025.75. So Deadpool accepts the job and set out to kill the Street Speeder.Â 
Â 
Deadpool tried a number of tactics to kill the speedster, from power launching himself at him with a net, to utilizing a rocket pack to catch up to him. All of his efforts ended in Wily E. Coyote fashion, frustrating Deadpool to no end. This only added to the bad week Deadpool was having, loosing his girlfriend Copycat and his love Siryn, and then having his home blown up by Kid Deadpool. Facing the burning remains of his home, the Street Speeder zoomed next to Deadpool, finally standing still. Without warning Deadpool achieved one good thing that day, by casually shooting the Street Speeder in the gut.
name: Street Speeder

deck: Sultan deals with slaves in Australia.
description: Sultan had hired a band of mercenaries to kidnap local people and then he sold them to slavery. Women however were brought to his personal harem. Tigra tried to release the Aborigines but was captured too. Sultan had a thing for exotic women and wanted Tigra to be one of his wives. She used Sultan's lust and got close to him, then by threatening his life Tigra's friends were released and returned to their homeland; Sultan was left behind swearing revenge.
name: Sultan

deck: This unnamed red-haired woman was the wife of Earth-15's General Zod (who was the Superman of that Universe). She was pregnant with their son when she was murdered by Superman Prime.
description:
Virtually nothing is known about the pregnant wife of Earth-15's Superman (General Zod) other than that they were both very happy together and were expecting a son.

One day however the mentally deranged Superman Prime ended up on Earth-15 while traveling across the new Multiverse in search of his home. Having taken Lex Luthor hostage (who he thought was Alexander Luthor of Earth-3) Prime went on a rampage across Earth-15.

He eventually came crashing through the walls of The Fortress of Solitude while Zod was listening to their unborn son. Prime killed Zod using a crystal. She screamed Zod's name and was then incinerated by Prime's heat-vision thus taking both her life and the life of her unborn child.
name: Zod's Wife

deck: Gunthar the Rigellian was a member of a space pirate crew, serving under Nebula. He could mentally control others, fire psionic blasts and increase his density to gain armor-like skin. He was cruel and mirthless, tormenting those lower than him in hierarchy.
description:
Gunthar is a Rigellian and member of a cosmic mercenary group led by Nebula.Â Â 

Creation

Gunthar was created by Roger Stern and John Buscema in 1985 and first appeared in The Avengers # 255.
name: Gunthar the Rigellian

deck: Fights repo men in future earth.
name: Ambient

deck: The Timekeeper is an entity that has knowledge of every happening through time and lives on another plane of existence to earth. He is styled after Salvidor Dali and his realm mirrors Dali's work with bare branched trees and melting clocks.
description:
The Timekeeper is an ancient being with knowledge of all history... all 13 billion years of it. He is obsessed by time and will tell you anything you wish to know for a price. His head is that for Salvidor Dali but his torso and arms are elongated and mantis like. From the waist down he is insect like with 4 legs and a brown abdomen. He wears a large analogue clock on a string around his neck.

Armageddon

In the third part of the Armageddon arc he is visited by Bedlam, Chastity and The Chosen team. He tells them he will share knowledge of the story of the beast known as Armageddon for a price. The price is to be stated and paid after the terms are agreed and the story told.

The tells the gathered that Armageddon was one of the six known Chaos Lords, but when he proclaimed himself to be superior over them, he was defeated in Chaos War and imprisoned in the Forever Wall. Their battle was so terrible that it shattered the primordial atom giving birth to our universe. Once freed he will use the Nexus of All things on Earth to unmake all things in the universe except himself so that he will become the universe. As to what can defeat him, the time keeper does not know but knows that it will require design and chance in combination. His tale told he demands his price and that is Oblivia. The others are shocked and refuse but Oblivia herself accepts saying she hopes that it will avoid her fate to die to save the world.

Later she is walking with the timekeeper and bites his neck. She drinks his blood and the knowledge he contains with it. She removes his head and travels back to earth.
name: Timekeeper

aliases:
Spirit in the four star dragon ball
Gohan
deck: Grandpa Gohan was the man who found and raised Goku as a child. He taught Goku Martal arts that he learned form Master Roshi, until Goku turns into the great ape.
description:
Powers and Abilities

Grandpa Gohan, as a student of the Turtle School, is a vastly powerful human and noted as being the second most powerful person in the Turtle Scholl behind Master Roshi until Goku and Krillin surpass them at the end of Dragonball. Gohan most noted to be the first person to teach Goku martial arts.

Techniques

Explosive Wave - A direct energy attack

Jan Ken Fist - One of the Turtle Schools early attacks. The user calls out the name and then adds either rock, scissor, or paper are corresponds with either a punch(rock), eye stab(scissor), or slap(paper).

Kamehameha Wave - The signature move of the Turtle School, Gohan leanred this move from Master Roshi. Gohan's seems to be just under Master Roshi's in terms of strength.

Thunder Shock Surprise - The Turtle Schools most deadly move where the user fires a large electric blast that traps the opponent and constantly shocks them as they cannot escape. This move was what Roshi used to defeat Gohan during a sparring match.

Turtle School Four Virtues - A rush attack used by Grandpa Gohan, where he attacks from the air with a variety of punches and kicks ending with a flying kick.

Other Media

Video Games

Dragon Ball: Advanced Adventure - Grandpa Gohan appears as a boss fight in line with his appearance in the manga and is then unlocked for free play

Dragon Ball: Revenge of King Piccolo - Grandpa Gohan appears as a boss fight in line with his appearance in the manga and is available as a playable character

Dragon Ball Online: Grandpa Gohan appears in the first time travel story quest for the game.

Dragon Ball: Origins - Grandpa Gohan appears as the final optional Boss for levels 1-7

Dragon Ball: Origins 2 - Grandpa Gohan appears as a boss fight in line with his appearance in the manga

Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi 2 - Grandpa Gohan appears as a playable character. He is whereing the fox mask that he uses to disguise himself when fighting Goku during the Fortuneteller Baba story line, though this will fall off with enough damage.

Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi 3 - Grandpa Gohan appears as a playable character. He has special dialogue with Goku when he is a Super Saiyan.

issue_credits.name: The World's Most Evil Crime Organization

name: Grandpa Gohan

deck: The Mystic Marauder.
name: Deathmask

aliases:
Scarlet Avenger

The Man Who Never Smiled
deck: The Man Who Never Smiled
description:
Origin

Scientist Jim Kendall along with his wife and son were passengers on an airplane that also happened to be carrying gold, taken over by ruthless criminals who murdered the pilot the plane to crashed killing everyone on board except for Kendell who lived but found that the crash had caused damage paralyzing his facial muscles so that he became âthe man who never smiled.â

Vowing to avenge himself on all criminals Kendall weaves a cloak made from a thin weave of steel that was both flexible and bullet-proof, as well as building a rocket car that can go as fast as 90 miles an hour, an airship he can control with his mind, and other devices such as guns that shoot paralyzing rays or super-magnetism, and a hypnotism machine which makes anyone who is exposed to it tell the truth, thus armed and leaving his emblem, a calling card with a flaming arrow emblazoned on it he commences to strike fear into the hearts of evil doers as the Scarlet Avenger.

He is soon joined by devoted followers who become his âOperatorsâ none of whom know who he really is, and at one point become so numerous that at one point he is able to launce a small air force against his arch-enemy Texa the Amazon and her Dirigible of Doom.

Eventually his operators drop off one by one until it is just him against evil, by that time he has also stopped using most of his remarkable devices and started to carry an ordinary .45 automatic.

Shortly after this the Scarlet Avenger is heard from no more.
name: Scarlet Avenger

volume_credits.name: Vixens, Vamps & Vipers: Lost Villainesses of Golden Age Comics

deck: Hey Rube!
description:
Reuben Reubens was a 12 year old orphan who hated the orphanage, running away he hides out in what he thinks is an abandoned castle, there he meets an old man who gives him an elixir that lets him meet his ancestors most of whom is seems where great men who were also named Rueben Reubens, each of these ancestors give him an aspect of what made them great, be it bravery, strength, stamina or toughness. (pretty much everything but brains)

After this Rueben finds that by shouting the old carnie warning of âHey Rube!â (even though none of his ancestors are known to have had anything to do with the carnival) he is able to turn into a powerful adult version of himself who becomes known as Red Rube.

He later becomes a cub reporter for the Daily Sun when not being Red Rube.
name: Red Rube

deck: Demoness from one of eight families.
description: Carnelian being from one of eight families of evil didn't like being hunted by Bedlam. So she came up with a plan; feed Bedlam as many evil souls as fast as possible. Overwhelmed by all the evil Bedlam would become evil himself. Made up her mind, she pushed the plan into action. Witnessing Bedlam taking on a group of demons, Carnelian joined the fight on his side. Pretending that she has fed up with her family murderous ways. Bedlam believed her. Together they jumped through time and space vanquishing evil in amazing rate. They even shared bed once a while. When nearing a critical mass, Bedlam and Carnelian happened into a time where past Bedlam was in. There Carnelian lets herself get kidnapped by the demons, and leaving trail for Bedlam to follow. Bedlam follows and absorbs the demons. The plan works, Bedlam is already transforming in appearance. Then all the sudden another Bedlam appears, the one from the past, and makes known that they knew the plan from the start. Together the two Bedlams kill everyone in the room. When Carnelian tries to escape she is killed and her soul absorbed.
name: Carnelian

deck: X-Factor foe. A human in the service of the demon Cloot. He was dragged to Hell by his master after he went crazy and threatened to kill X-Factor instead of making the mutant team serve Cloot as he promised.
description:
Origin

Charlie Ronalds went through a traumatic experience as a young child when his parents were murdered by a mutant after watching the movie, Batman. Ronalds had a deep seeded hatred for mutants ever since and even went to school with one named Guido Carosella as a teenager. Ronalds attacked Guido after his mutant ability surfaced after being hit by a school bus. Ronalds was hospitalized after Strong Guy lashed out in a panic. Ronalds eventually recovered from his injuries and started to dabble in black magic. Ronalds would travel abroad and study the dark arts until his trust fund was depleted. One night, Ronalds summoned the demon Mr. Cloot and he offered Ronalds power and access to his realm in exchange for the souls of the X-Factor members. Ronalds accepted the deal and was transformed into a magically enhanced demon called Charon. X-Factor was attacked during a meeting by Charon and three enemies from X-Factor's past named Carnivore, Number One Fan and Professor Vic Chalker. The resurrected henchmen were defeated when Polaris blasted Professor Chalker into the blades of Number One Fan who was lasered in half in return and Multiple Man created a duplicate inside the mouth of Carnivore which blew the reptilian foe apart. Strong Guy realized that Charlie was Charon during the fight but he was eventually swallowed by Cloot for failing to close his end of the deal.

Creation

Charon was created by Peter David and Terry Shoemaker in 1993 and first appeared in X-Factor Annual # 8.

Powers & Abilities

Charon was granted eldritch power from Satannish and possessed the ability to emit hellfire from his hands or his demon staff. Charon also had enhanced strength, durability and resistance to injury.

name: Charon

However his failure at the latest quest cost him loss of favor with the Beast, the immortal being worshipped by the Hand and the Snakeroot. Daito was tortured, humiliated and led to commit ritual suicide with Sakki, the sacred sword of the order.

deck: A former holy man and torturer of Snakeroot.
description:
Genkotsu was a member of the Snakeroot, an organization with complex ties to the Hand. The organization were reportedly successors of an Inner Circle within the Hand that somehow became independent. In modern times they still had influence over the Hand or at least a faction of it. Genkotsu himself was a "holy" man who sought peace for much of his life. Somehow his quest ended with him as the chief torturer within the Snakeroot and among their leading magic users. He precided in the ceremony which created Erynys.

He faced Elektra in battle and was killed but then resurrected by his teammates. She did not go easy on him in their next encounter. She crashed a truck into him, costing him the use of his back and legs. The Snakeroot decided to let him die instead of ensuring the survival of a paralyzed body.

deck: A former lover of Elektra. Member and later leader of Snakeroot.
description:
History

Â 
Tekagi was once a member of the Hand and a lover of Elektra. He later joined Snakeroot and reached the position of second-in-command under Lord Daito. When Daito commited ritual suicide, Tekagi succeeded him. He led them to several missions and faced Elektra again, as an enemy instead of a lover. He defeated her in single combat but let her live. He argued that she could not stop their further plans. The other Snakeroot members suspected Tekagi simply harbored feelings for her.

She returned to face him again and he was again about to defeat her. But this time there was a significant difference. Her weapons were coated with venom. The various small cuts in his body were poisoned and was quickly succumbing to it. Elektra used Sakki, the sacred sword of the order, to kill Tekagi.

issue_credits.name: Book Three: Hour of the Wolf
Book One: The Force of the Killer
Fall From Grace - Conclusion: Salvation For The Damned!

name: Tekagi

description: When the powerful demon Termagaira was split in hald, each part gained a seperated body and identity. Megaira became a female demon and lover to her male counterpart Termagent. She was a bloodthirsty warrior who used bladed weapons in combat. She also had superhuman strength, able to lift at least 10 tons. Her gauntlents contained devices producing electricity, allowing her to blast her opponents with it. She was eventually merged back to Termagaira.
name: Megaira

Blood and their descendants are immortal and do not seem to age over the millenia. Her primary ability was sensing the true nature of everyone in her immediate vicinity. She could see through deception and disguises. She was assassinated by Modred the Mystic.

deck: The Rattler was an identity used by two villains of the American Old West.
description:
Brief History

The original Rattler was Heath Benson. He was a highly skilled athlete, specializing in gymnastics and aerial maneuvers. He was extremely agile and had above average strength without actually being superhuman. He had some skills with a gun. Heath was originally an acrobat but got injured during a performance and retired. He re-emerged as the ringmaster of a new circus. His body had in time recovered from its wounds and Heath got back in to shape. He kept both facts secret. He created a secret identity for himself as the Rattler.

As the circus traveled, Heath would raid several towns and ranches as the Rattler. He could rob his targets and swiftly return to his work with the circus. He managed to defeat Rawhide Kid in their first encounter. The Kid managed to follow his trail to the circus, finding out its only known acrobat was Whirlo. The Kid challenged Whirlo to aerial combat and came out on top. Only to face the real Rattler next. He again won and unmasked Heath.

Heath later managed to escape from prison but kept a low profile. In his absence Whirlo decided to assume the Rattler identity, figuring any crimes committed by him would be blamed on Benson. However his scheme was uncovered by the Two-Gun Kid.

In 1876, Benson resurfaced as member of a new gang of extraordinary criminals, led by Iron Mask. They eventually faced the time-traveling West Coast Avengers. Benson managed to use his agility to get a hold of Tigra. Only to have her turn the tables and rip him to shreds with her claws. She used his unconscious body to knock out Hurricane.

issue_credits.name: Lost In Space And Time, Part 2

name: Rattler

volume_credits.name: Avengers: West Coast Avengers - Lost in Space-Time
